home.title: International Emergency Guide
home.subtitle: Your trusted source for emergency medical information
home.description: Access step-by-step emergency procedures, treatment guidelines, medication information, and locate nearby hospitals - all in one place.

emergencyNumbers.title: International Emergency Numbers

emergencyNumbers.selectCountry: Please select a country to view emergency numbers
emergencyNumbers.noData: No emergency numbers data available for this country

hospitals.description: Locate the nearest hospitals and medical facilities to get emergency care when needed.
hospitals.noResults: No hospitals found in this area
hospitals.apiKeyRequired: A Google Maps API key is required to view the map

protocols.title: Emergency Protocols
protocols.description: Step-by-step emergency protocols for critical situations that require immediate medical attention.

protocolDescriptions.fire-emergency: Comprehensive guide on how to respond to fires, including prevention, detection, evacuation, and basic firefighting techniques.
protocolDescriptions.fire-hose: Step-by-step guide on how to properly use emergency fire hoses to combat fires safely and effectively.
protocolDescriptions.cpr: Step-by-step guide for cardiopulmonary resuscitation in emergency situations.
protocolDescriptions.choking: Emergency procedures for choking incidents including the Heimlich maneuver.
protocolDescriptions.bleeding: Protocol for controlling severe bleeding and preventing shock.
protocolDescriptions.burns: First aid for different types and degrees of burns.
protocolDescriptions.fracture: Handling bone fractures and joint dislocations safely.
protocolDescriptions.heart-attack: Recognizing symptoms and emergency response for heart attack.
protocolDescriptions.stroke: FAST protocol and emergency care for stroke victims.
protocolDescriptions.seizure: Proper care during and after seizures and when to seek emergency help.
protocolDescriptions.anaphylaxis: Responding to severe allergic reactions and using epinephrine auto-injectors.
protocolDescriptions.hypothermia: Identifying and treating cold-related emergencies and preventing further injury.
protocolDescriptions.heatstroke: Recognizing and responding to heat-related emergencies that can be life-threatening.
protocolDescriptions.poisoning: First aid for different types of poisoning including ingestion, inhalation, and skin contact.
protocolDescriptions.drowning: Rescue techniques and emergency care for drowning victims.
protocolDescriptions.diabetic: Managing hypoglycemia, hyperglycemia, and diabetic ketoacidosis emergencies.
protocolDescriptions.spinalinjury: Immobilization techniques and precautions for suspected spinal injuries.
protocolDescriptions.eyeinjury: Emergency procedures for chemical exposures, foreign objects, and traumatic eye injuries.
protocolDescriptions.dental: Managing broken teeth, severe pain, and other dental emergencies.
protocolDescriptions.electrical: Safety procedures and first aid for electrical shock and electrocution.
protocolDescriptions.fire-safety-equipment: Comprehensive guide to fire safety equipment including extinguishers, alarms, sprinklers, and safety gear.
protocolDescriptions.bites: Treatment for bites and stings from animals, insects, and venomous creatures.
protocolDescriptions.childbirth: Assisting with unexpected childbirth outside of medical facilities.
protocolDescriptions.chest-pain: Evaluating chest pain and determining appropriate emergency response.
protocolDescriptions.overdose: Recognition and management of drug overdose emergencies including opioid overdose response.
protocolDescriptions.shock: Identifying different types of shock and providing appropriate emergency care.
protocolDescriptions.head-injury: Assessment and management of traumatic head injuries and concussion protocol.
protocolDescriptions.psychiatric: Safely responding to acute mental health crises and psychiatric emergencies.

prevention.title: Prevention
prevention.description: Install smoke alarms on every floor and in key areas like bedrooms and kitchens. Test them monthly and replace batteries annually. Keep fire extinguishers accessible and learn how to use them. Create and practice a home fire escape plan with all household members.

detection.title: Early Fire Detection
detection.description: Know the signs of fire: visible flames, smoke, burning smell, unusual warmth, crackling sounds, or smoke detector alarms. Early detection saves lives and property.

assess.title: Assess the Fire Situation
assess.description: Quickly determine the size, location, and type of fire (electrical, grease, paper/wood, chemical). Small, contained fires may be manageable, but prepare to evacuate immediately if the fire is spreading rapidly.

alarm.title: Activate the Alarm and Call Emergency Services
alarm.description: Pull the fire alarm if in a public building. Call emergency services immediately (911 in US, 101 in Mongolia). Give your exact location and details about the fire. Never assume someone else has called.

evacuation.title: Evacuation Priorities
evacuation.description: People first, possessions second. Alert everyone in the building. Help those who need assistance. Never re-enter a burning building for belongings.

safeescape.title: Safe Evacuation Techniques
safeescape.description: Stay low to avoid smoke inhalation (crawl if necessary). Test doors before opening - use the back of your hand to feel for heat. If the door is hot, find another exit route. Close doors behind you to slow fire spread. Use stairs, never elevators.

trapped.title: If Trapped in a Room
trapped.description: Block smoke from entering by placing wet towels or clothing under doors. Signal for help from windows. If possible, call emergency services to report your exact location. Cover your mouth and nose with a damp cloth.

assess.title: Check Responsiveness
assess.description: Tap the person's shoulders and shout 'Are you okay?' If no response, continue with CPR.

call.title: Call for Help
call.description: Call emergency services immediately and get an AED if available.

position.title: Position the Person
position.description: Place the person on their back on a firm, flat surface. Tilt the head back slightly and lift the chin.

compressions.title: Begin Chest Compressions
compressions.description: Place the heel of your hand on the center of the chest between the nipples. Push hard and fast at least 2 inches deep at a rate of 100-120 compressions per minute.

rescue.title: Give Rescue Breaths
rescue.description: After 30 compressions, give 2 rescue breaths. Tilt head back, lift chin, pinch nose closed, and give 2 breaths.

continue.title: Continue CPR
continue.description: Continue cycles of 30 compressions and 2 breaths until emergency services arrive or the person starts breathing normally.

treatment.title: Treatment Guidelines
treatment.description: Comprehensive treatment guidelines for various medical conditions.

symptoms.description: Identify potential medical conditions based on your symptoms.
symptoms.comingSoonDesc: Our interactive symptom checker is currently under development. Please check back soon.

damageAssessment.title: AI Damage Assessment
damageAssessment.description: Use your camera to assess damage in real-time and get safety recommendations.
damageAssessment.cameraPermission: Camera access is required for this feature
damageAssessment.apiKeyMissing: API key required for damage assessment
damageAssessment.uploadInstructions: Upload a photo or take one with your camera to assess damage
damageAssessment.disclaimer: This AI assessment provides an initial evaluation only and should not replace professional medical or emergency services judgment. In case of serious injury, seek professional help immediately.

medicalImaging.title: Medical Imaging Analysis
medicalImaging.description: Upload X-ray, MRI, or other medical images for AI-powered analysis and insights.
medicalImaging.uploadFirst: Upload or capture an image to get started
medicalImaging.askQuestion: Ask a question about medical imaging...
medicalImaging.welcomeMessage: Hello! I'm your medical imaging assistant. I can help analyze X-rays, MRIs, and other medical images. Upload an image or ask me questions about medical imaging.
medicalImaging.apiKeyRequired: An API key is required for medical imaging analysis
medicalImaging.disclaimer: This AI analysis is for informational purposes only and does not replace professional medical diagnosis. Always consult with a qualified healthcare provider for proper interpretation of medical images and treatment decisions.
